content:
• Monday, September 19, 2011
  • TGT

    Target (NYSE:TGT) extends its Target Center naming rights partnership with the Minnesota...

    Target (NYSE:TGT) extends its Target Center naming rights partnership with the Minnesota Timberwolves NBA franchise through 2014. Target has been the sole naming-rights holder of the facility since the building opened in 1990. Shares -1.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:47 PM
  • KONA

    Microcap Kona Grill (NASDAQ:KONA) jumps after raising its Q3 revenue and net income guidance due...

    Microcap Kona Grill (NASDAQ:KONA) jumps after raising its Q3 revenue and net income guidance due to strong sales growth. The updated guidance anticipates same-store sales growth of approximately 9% Y/Y, compared to 6% growth previously forecasted. Shares +16% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:31 PM
  • WES

    Western Gas Partners (NYSE:WES) announces a 5M unit secondary offering. Deutsche Bank, UBS,...

    Western Gas Partners (NYSE:WES) announces a 5M unit secondary offering. Deutsche Bank, UBS, Wells Fargo, Barclays Capital, Citigroup and Morgan Stanley are acting as joint book runners. Shares -4.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:25 PM
  • DS

    Newcastle Investment (NCT) announces a 22.5M share secondary offering. Citigroup, Barclays...

    Newcastle Investment (NCT) announces a 22.5M share secondary offering. Citigroup, Barclays Capital, Morgan Stanley and UBS are acting as joint book runners, with Macquarie and Stifel Nicolaus Weisel acting as co-managers. Shares -9.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:21 PM
  • MLNX

    Mellanox Technologies (NASDAQ:MLNX) announces a 3M share secondary offering. J.P. Morgan, Credit...

    Mellanox Technologies (NASDAQ:MLNX) announces a 3M share secondary offering. J.P. Morgan, Credit Suisse and Barclays Capital will be joint book runners, with Stifel Nicolaus Weisel acting as co-manager. Shares -3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:15 PM
  • JAZZ

    Jazz Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:JAZZ) is now down 5.1% AH following the announcement of its merger...

    Jazz Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:JAZZ) is now down 5.1% AH following the announcement of its merger with Azur Pharma.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:48 PM
  • JAZZ

    Jazz Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:JAZZ) is halted after the company announces it will merge with...

    Jazz Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:JAZZ) is halted after the company announces it will merge with Ireland's Azur Pharma in an all-stock deal. Like Jazz, Azur develops drugs for treating women's health and central nervous system issues. The combined company will have $475M+ in revenue and $200M+ in cash flow in its first 12 months.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM | 1 Comment
  • SGEN

    Seattle Genetics (SGEN +4.4%) surges after RBC's Jason Kantor boosts his 2011 and 2012 sales...

    Seattle Genetics (SGEN +4.4%) surges after RBC's Jason Kantor boosts his 2011 and 2012 sales forecasts for the company's recently-approved Adcetris drug for treating lymphoma. Kantor claims an RBC survey of 100 hematologists suggests "rapid early adoption" of Adcetris.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:50 PM
  • P

    Pandora (NYSE:P) racks up a 5% gain after Wedbush Securities chimes in with an Outperform rating...

    Pandora (NYSE:P) racks up a 5% gain after Wedbush Securities chimes in with an Outperform rating and a $14 price target on shares. Analyst Michael Pachter points to a user-growth rate that "easily outpaces" rivals in justifying his bullish stance.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM
  • PIR

    Pier 1 Imports (PIR +6.4%) jumps on an upgrade to buy on valuation by KeyBanc, saying the...

    Pier 1 Imports (PIR +6.4%) jumps on an upgrade to buy on valuation by KeyBanc, saying the company has a dominant market share, and the stock should find support from a number of accelerated buybacks.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM
  • LUK-OLD

    Jefferies Group (JEF -3.4%) files a lawsuit against NASDAQ OMX Group (NDAQ -1.4%) accusing the...

    Jefferies Group (JEF -3.4%) files a lawsuit against NASDAQ OMX Group (NDAQ -1.4%) accusing the firm's International Derivatives Clearing Group unit of fraud and breach of contract in relation to interest-rate swap futures.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:43 PM
  • LDK

    This may be a first, at least for an actively traded stock: A company repurchases stock, then...

    This may be a first, at least for an actively traded stock: A company repurchases stock, then says it repurchased too much and sold shares to get the cash back. That's the story at LDK Solar (LDK -6.4%), which says it sold a private placement of ~4.4M shares. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM | 2 Comments
  • DNKN

    Shares of Dunkin' Brands (NASDAQ:DNKN) grab a 4.4% gain out of thin air, extending a 5-day...

    Shares of Dunkin' Brands (NASDAQ:DNKN) grab a 4.4% gain out of thin air, extending a 5-day momentum rally. The company's westward expansion plans may get a brand visibility lift after it starts airing promotions on ESPN's Monday Night Countdown show that will hit new markets.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:26 PM

  • Reuters reports Greek finmin Venizelos saying the country is close to a deal with the Troika...

    Reuters reports Greek finmin Venizelos saying the country is close to a deal with the Troika following this evening's conference call. With the Greek situation seemingly fixed, stocks and the euro rally. The common currency is 120 pips off the lows, -0.8% at $1.3680.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:20 PM | 5 Comments
  • OSIS

    OSI Systems (OSIS +7.1%) rallies as its security division receives a $98M U.S. Army contract to...

    OSI Systems (OSIS +7.1%) rallies as its security division receives a $98M U.S. Army contract to provide x-ray inspection systems in Afghanistan. Morgan Keegan estimates the systems will be shipped during the next 18-24 months and add $0.30-$0.40 to EPS during that time, and is "another sign of the momentum in their security business."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:16 PM
  • ORLY

    Shares of O'Reilly Automotive (ORLY +0.3%) continue moving higher after Barclays Capital ups its...

    Shares of O'Reilly Automotive (ORLY +0.3%) continue moving higher after Barclays Capital ups its price target to $80 from $71, citing improving fundamentals and low exposure to Q4 profit volatility. The shares have been impervious to the volatility we've seen since early August, powering 30% higher without any pause.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:09 PM
  • PEP

    Pepsi (PEP -3%) gets hit as CLSA downgrades the shares to underperform and reduces its EPS and...

    Pepsi (PEP -3%) gets hit as CLSA downgrades the shares to underperform and reduces its EPS and revenue estimates for 2011/12. CLSA says the company's disproportionately exposed to high corn prices due to its heavy use of high-fructose corn syrup, and weak beverage-share trends means it will struggle to raise prices without additional volume losses.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM | 1 Comment
  • CMG

    Shares of Chipotle (NYSE:CMG) are up 5.5% on heavy volume as the stock breaks through technical...

    Shares of Chipotle (NYSE:CMG) are up 5.5% on heavy volume as the stock breaks through technical barriers and attracts institutional investors. The company isn't backing down after staring down the barrel of a loaded recession - opening a new Asian fast-casual restaurant in Washington DC that could be a harbinger of a whole new franchise.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:40 PM
  • OPTR

    Optimer Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:OPTR) is up 6.4% after Jefferies reiterates a Buy and $17 PT....

    Optimer Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:OPTR) is up 6.4% after Jefferies reiterates a Buy and $17 PT. The firm is bullish on better-than-expected sales of Optimer's Dificid drug, and on the pending EU launch of the drug by partner Astellas (OTCPK:ALPMY). Jefferies also thinks milestone payment from Astellas will strengthen Optimer's cash position.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:34 PM
  • GTATQ

    Weakness in GT Advanced Technologies (GTAT -9.8%) is exacerbated by SEC reports showing CEO...

    Weakness in GT Advanced Technologies (GTAT -9.8%) is exacerbated by SEC reports showing CEO Thomas Gutierrez sold 234,574 shares of the company last week. Whatever his personal reasons may be for making the sale, the market is viewing the action as a vote of "no confidence."
     
     
     
     
    | 2:33 PM
  • AGN

    Strength in Watson Pharmaceuticals (WPI +3.9%) is attributed to reports of FDA approval of...

    Strength in Watson Pharmaceuticals (WPI +3.9%) is attributed to reports of FDA approval of Watson partner Amphastar's generic version of Sanofi's (SNY -2.4%) Lovenox blood thinner. Momenta (MNTA -25.9%) and partner Novartis (NVS -1.5%) have sold generic Lovenox exclusively in the U.S. for more than a year.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM
  • NYX

    Exchange operators take a hit today as a resurgent European financial crisis stokes volatility...

    Exchange operators take a hit today as a resurgent European financial crisis stokes volatility and heightens concern over trading and revenues: NYSE Euronext (NYX -5%), Nasdaq OMX Group (NDAQ -3.5%).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM
  • GM

    Barclays reiterates an Overweight on GM (GM +0.7%) as its shares outperform following a new...

    Barclays reiterates an Overweight on GM (GM +0.7%) as its shares outperform following a new contract with the UAW. Barclays sees the deal meeting its expectations for a "mildly inflationary contract" that increases profit sharing, but lowers tier-two wage costs over the long-term. It thinks the new contract could affect GM's annual EPS by $0.03.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM
  • SEIC

    Mutual fund administrator SEI Investments (SEIC -6%) trades lower after Oppenheimer cut the...

    Mutual fund administrator SEI Investments (SEIC -6%) trades lower after Oppenheimer cut the shares to perform. Oppenheimer cites the company's exposure to recent market volatility and weakness which is negatively impacting sales trends.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM
  • DYN

    Dynergy (NYSE:DYN) falls 6.3% after S&P warns it could lower the energy wholesaler's debt...

    Dynergy (NYSE:DYN) falls 6.3% after S&P warns it could lower the energy wholesaler's debt ratings to selective default if it completes a restructuring plan announced on Thursday. According to the plan, up to $1.25B in outstanding debt would be swapped for new 10% notes due in 2018, with lenders receiving 60-72% of their principal.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:43 PM
  • SVNTQ

    Shares of Savient Pharmaceuticals (SVNT +7.5%) continue to climb after SEC filings show several...

    Shares of Savient Pharmaceuticals (SVNT +7.5%) continue to climb after SEC filings show several key executives (I, II, III, IV) , including CEO John Johnson, purchased stock in the company last week.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM | 2 Comments
  • ITP

    Chinese forest products firm Orient Paper (ONP +6.4%) gets a boost from the announcement that...

    Chinese forest products firm Orient Paper (ONP +6.4%) gets a boost from the announcement that its Chairman and CEO Zhenyong Liu intends to purchase up to $400K worth of stock over the next three months. The purchase looks to be quite a bargain, considering the stock has has lost 65% of its value over the past year.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:18 PM | 2 Comments

  • The CBOE Volatility Index jumps 11% to above 34 as European drama and macroeconomic worries play...

    The CBOE Volatility Index jumps 11% to above 34 as European drama and macroeconomic worries play out. Taking a longer view, the VIX hasn't dropped below 30 since the S&P downgraded U.S. debt in early August - showing "market fear" is still on a hair trigger.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:18 PM

  • The precious metals break form, sliding even as fear shows itself on the equity, bond, currency,...

    The precious metals break form, sliding even as fear shows itself on the equity, bond, currency, and other commodity markets. Gold gives up early gains, now -1.7% at $1,784. Silver -3.4% at $39.43.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:10 PM | 1 Comment
  • VCEL

    Drug developer Aastrom (ASTM +5.2%) is trading higher after saying the 12-month follow-up data...

    Drug developer Aastrom (ASTM +5.2%) is trading higher after saying the 12-month follow-up data from clinical trials for its drug ixmyelocel-T showed that treatment was well-tolerated, and efficacy observations were consistent with improved heart function.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:06 PM
  • STMP

    Not even a day that sees tickers flowing in red can slow down Stamps.com (NASDAQ:STMP). Shares...

    Not even a day that sees tickers flowing in red can slow down Stamps.com (NASDAQ:STMP). Shares are up 8.5% for the day, 16% in the last week and 59% for the month - flying along on momentum the online postage provider is set for a revenue boost.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:04 PM
  • AAPL

    Apple (AAPL +2%) is outperforming strongly today, and creating new all-time highs in the...

    Apple (AAPL +2%) is outperforming strongly today, and creating new all-time highs in the process. A bullish J.P. Morgan note could be playing a role, but investors might also be buying in due to the company's low multiples relative to its growth rate.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:03 PM | 1 Comment
  • IAG

    Iamgold (IAG +0.7%) trades higher today after the miner reports "encouraging" new drilling...

    Iamgold (IAG +0.7%) trades higher today after the miner reports "encouraging" new drilling results in its exploration of the rare earth elements adjacent to its Niobec niobium mine in Quebec, Canada.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM
  • SMRT

    Shares of Stein Mart (NASDAQ:SMRT) are down 7.3% after the firm announces its CEO has retired....

    Shares of Stein Mart (NASDAQ:SMRT) are down 7.3% after the firm announces its CEO has retired. The fashion retailer has seen declining same-store sales, and its stock has dropped 30% for the year.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM
  • SVM

    Silvercorp (SVM -5.7%) responds to the latest allegations by Alfred LIttle, contending it is the...

    Silvercorp (SVM -5.7%) responds to the latest allegations by Alfred LIttle, contending it is the victim of a well-organized scheme by short-sellers. The miner points out discrepancies in LIttle's own research as well as questioning what expertise the firm has in analyzing ore samples "dropped" from a truck.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM
  • MEIP

    Marshall Edwards (MSHL +4.5%) pops after the company says its first patient was dosed in the...

    Marshall Edwards (MSHL +4.5%) pops after the company says its first patient was dosed in the Phase I clinical trial of its lead drug candidate ME-143, a treatment for patients with refractory solid tumors.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM
  • MWE

    MarkWest Energy Partners (MWE +2.4%) is higher today after Citi initiates coverage with a buy...

    MarkWest Energy Partners (MWE +2.4%) is higher today after Citi initiates coverage with a buy and adds it to its Top Picks list. Citi says the driller has one of the most attractive asset positions in the Marcellus shale play plus a solid project inventory that are likely to continue to grow over the next five years.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM
  • MNTA

    Shares of Momenta Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:MNTA) crash 23% immediately after the FDA announces it...

    Shares of Momenta Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:MNTA) crash 23% immediately after the FDA announces it has approved rival Amphastar Pharmaceuticals to market a generic version of Lovenox - posing a serious threat to MNTA's share of the blood thinner market.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM | 2 Comments
  • MLNX

    EZchip Semiconductor (EZCH -3.5%) is down after Auriga cuts it to hold on valuation and lowers...

    EZchip Semiconductor (EZCH -3.5%) is down after Auriga cuts it to hold on valuation and lowers its price target to $37 from $39.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM

  • Forest Labs (FRX -2.6%) is lower this morning after Goldman cut it to sell, saying the company's...

    Forest Labs (FRX -2.6%) is lower this morning after Goldman cut it to sell, saying the company's product line is in decline and it's saddled with higher operating leverage costs.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM
  • CNQ

    Sterne Agee downgrades a number of oil stocks this morning after cutting overall commodity-price...

    Sterne Agee downgrades a number of oil stocks this morning after cutting overall commodity-price expectations between 5-10% for the second half. The firm reduces the following to hold: Canadian Natural Resources (CNQ -4.8%), Continental Resources (CLR -3%), Forest Oil (FST -1.6%) and Penn Virginia (PVA -7.4%).

     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM

  • The copper market has "broken down," plunging 3.9% today to $3.78/lb., its lowest price since...

    The copper market has "broken down," plunging 3.9% today to $3.78/lb., its lowest price since November. Copper is now down 10% so far this month, and nearly 17% since early August began. Dr. Copper could be sending a warning signal about the global economy.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM | 3 Comments
  • AATI

    Advanced Analogic (AATI -14.6%), which fell 10 days ago after would-be acquirer Skyworks (SWKS...

    Advanced Analogic (AATI -14.6%), which fell 10 days ago after would-be acquirer Skyworks (SWKS -2.9%) filed a formal notice of breach, drops again after Skyworks discloses its belief Advanced Analogic has conducted business in an unusual manner, and states the latter opposes a plan by the former to delay a merger vote until the end of Q4.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM
  • SVM

    Silvercorp (SVM -7.4%) is sliding on another Alfred Little report alleging the company's income...

    Silvercorp (SVM -7.4%) is sliding on another Alfred Little report alleging the company's income is inflated by 5 times. The paper includes the results of video surveillance of delivery trucks indicating far lower levels of production than reported, and evidence the firm's largest customer is a "related party."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM
  • ASIA

    AsiaInfo-Linkage (ASIA -12.7%) gets hit today after Susquehanna cut the shares to neutral and...

    AsiaInfo-Linkage (ASIA -12.7%) gets hit today after Susquehanna cut the shares to neutral and halved its price target to $11. The firm says the telecom software industry in China is showing signs of maturing, and consensus expectations are too high.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM
  • AMAT

    The recent rally in chip equipment stocks (SMH -1.7%) has created significant downside risk for...

    The recent rally in chip equipment stocks (SMH -1.7%) has created significant downside risk for the group, Goldman Sachs writes in cutting ratings for Applied Materials (AMAT -3.6%) and Lam Research (LAM -5.3%). "Record shipments to the foundries and Intel (NASDAQ:INTC) will lead to excess supply and a downward trend in orders through mid-2012."
     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM
  • WMGI

    Shares of Wright Medical Group (NASDAQ:WMGI) move 6.4% higher after the company names Robert...

    Shares of Wright Medical Group (NASDAQ:WMGI) move 6.4% higher after the company names Robert Palmisano as its President and CEO, completing a 5-month search following the resignation of its previous CEO in the midst of a scandal.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM
  • VC

    Auto-parts maker Visteon (VC +0.8%) is in the green this morning after an article in Barron's...

    Auto-parts maker Visteon (VC +0.8%) is in the green this morning after an article in Barron's over the weekend says the stock is an undervalued play on Asia's booming automotive market. The shares could hit $85 next year as earnings growth takes off.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM
  • PRAN

    Prana Biotechnology (PRAN +16%) soars after The Journal Of Neurochemistry publishes an update on...

    Prana Biotechnology (PRAN +16%) soars after The Journal Of Neurochemistry publishes an update on Prana's experimental drug PBT2 for the treatment of Alzheimer's Disease. The study explains how the drug is able to restore cognition in Alzheimer's sufferers by repairing affected Alzheimer's brain sections.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM
  • ART

    Artio Global (ART -10.4%) gets hammered this morning after Ticonderoga downgrades it to sell,...

    Artio Global (ART -10.4%) gets hammered this morning after Ticonderoga downgrades it to sell, citing larger-than-expected client liquidations and significant asset depreciation.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM
  • AZO

    Shares of AutoZone (AZO +0.5%) get a boost when Goldman Sachs lifts its PT to $313 from $294,...

    Shares of AutoZone (AZO +0.5%) get a boost when Goldman Sachs lifts its PT to $313 from $294, though it keeps a Sell rating locked in place. AZN has been getting some attention as a "defensive play" with consumers seen looking to save money with clunkers, helping lifting the stock 15% over the last month.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM
  • GTATQ

    Solar stocks (TAN -6.1%) are getting beat up, led by a steep 12% decline in GTAT Advanced...

    Solar stocks (TAN -6.1%) are getting beat up, led by a steep 12% decline in GTAT Advanced Technologies (GTAT) and a disaster at JinkoSolar (JKS -23.3%). Weak demand is also creating pricing pressure throughout the industry. Decliners: STP -8.7%, TSL -7.7%, LDK -7%, JASO -8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM | 1 Comment
  • COL

    Shares of Rockwell Collins (COL -5.1%) fall off sharply after it looks like the firm has fallen...

    Shares of Rockwell Collins (COL -5.1%) fall off sharply after it looks like the firm has fallen off of United Technologies' (UTX -1.8%) radar for an acquisition bid.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM
  • CAT

    Raymond James still likes Caterpillar (NYSE:CAT), but reduces its rating on the company to...

    Raymond James still likes Caterpillar (NYSE:CAT), but reduces its rating on the company to Outperform from Strong Buy. "It is impossible for us to ignore the effects that a global economic slowdown will have on CAT’s business." Shares down 2.4% premarket after climbing 5% in a mini-rally last week.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:14 AM | 1 Comment
  • GR

    Premarket gainers: GR +22%. TYC +7%. SGMO +3%.Losers: JKS -15%. ING -7%. LYG -7%. RBS -7%. BCS...

    Premarket gainers: GR +22%. TYC +7%. SGMO +3%.
    Losers: JKS -15%. ING -7%. LYG -7%. RBS -7%. BCS -6%. MT -6%. BBVA -5%. CS -5%. SAP -4%. LOGI -4%. RIO -4%. TEF -4%. ALU -4%. FTE -4%. SNY -4%. AMAT -4%. BHP -4%. SDRL -4%. DRYS -4%. TOT -3%. DB -4%. RBS -3%. NOK -3%. BP -3%. C-3 VOD -3%. SI -3%. STD -3%. UBS -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM | 1 Comment
  • SGMO

    Shares of Sangamo BioSciences (NASDAQ:SGMO) jump 5.5% higher premarket after the firm announces...

    Shares of Sangamo BioSciences (NASDAQ:SGMO) jump 5.5% higher premarket after the firm announces results from a Phase 1 clinical program to develop a HIV/AIDS therapeutic treatment. "The data obtained in our treatment interruption studies are very exciting and represent significant progress toward a 'functional cure' for HIV/AIDS."

     
     
     
     
    | 8:16 AM
  • JKS

    JinkoSolar (NYSE:JKS) falls 11.4% premarket after a toxic chemical leak forces the closure of a...

    JinkoSolar (NYSE:JKS) falls 11.4% premarket after a toxic chemical leak forces the closure of a plant in China and leads to violent protests against the solar panel company.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:11 AM
  • GR

    Shares of Goodrich (NYSE:GR) are up 19% premarket after reports continue to point to United...

    Shares of Goodrich (NYSE:GR) are up 19% premarket after reports continue to point to United Technologies (NYSE:UTX) launching a takeover bid. A Jefferies analyst see the logic behind the move, saying "from a distribution channel basis, from a mentality basis, from a customer focus basis, it's all there."

     
     
     
     
    | 8:04 AM
  • JCI

    Tyco (TYC) shares climb 7.6% premarket following its announcement to split into 3 separate...

    Tyco (TYC) shares climb 7.6% premarket following its announcement to split into 3 separate public companies.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:00 AM | 1 Comment
  • LEN

    Lennar (NYSE:LEN): FQ3 EPS of $0.11 in-line. Revenue of $820.2M (-0.6% Y/Y) beats by $10M....

    Lennar (NYSE:LEN): FQ3 EPS of $0.11 in-line. Revenue of $820.2M (-0.6% Y/Y) beats by $10M. Shares -2.2% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:17 AM
